column4: I've sent a Ubuntu CD to my sister who has apparently installed it and doing fine with it, but, was wondering if any media player is installed by default?  And if not, how is the easiest way to tell her how to install mplayer or xine?
totem gstreamer is deafault but not really great unless al the codecs have been installed and totem gstreamer replaces with totem-xine
I've not tried totem or gstreamer yet, but will check into those as well.
well I have all the codecs needed and that particular link you gave seems to be stubborn to play
I use mplayer and the mozilla-mplayer plugin for firefox to play online movies etc
that link opens up mplayer but it won't play, the video may be unavailable
she is running dapper or edgy?
here is the link for the restricted format read carefully https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RestrictedFormats
also make sure you have enabled all of the repositories
what is the easiest way to tell her how to enable all repositories
well .. the easiest way is to go to synaptic , click on system then repsositories and be sure they are al checked
however the best way is to use the terminal and type this ins   sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list

when the repsitory list comes up, you want to look for the files that star with "deb" and if they have an "#" in front of it, just remove the #  for all of them and then click the red "X" and hit save
then in the terminal you want to type sudo apt-get update
let that run its course... then you can sudo apt-get  thename of file youwant to install
